subject: Re: [junit] Running the tests from JUnit 4.3 GUI
msgSnippet: Good point. I have no idea, as I haven t used the Swing runner in 6-12 months if not longer... Just thought the question was very ambiguous -- xyz didn t
messageBody:
Good point. I have no idea, as I haven't used the Swing runner in 6-12
months if not longer... Just thought the question was very ambiguous
-- "xyz didn't work, how do I fix it".

Wayne

On 4/6/07, David Jackman <david.jackman@...> wrote:
> Actually, I thought that the Swing GUI runner was removed in JUnit 4.x
> in favor of GUI runners built into most IDEs now.
>
> ________________________________
>
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> Wayne Fay
> Sent: Friday, April 06, 2007 8:51 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Running the tests from JUnit 4.3 GUI
>
>
>
> What (exactly) is the error message you are receiving?
>
> This is like calling your mechanic on the phone and saying your car
> won't start and expecting a diagnosis without providing additional
> information...
>
> Wayne
>
> On 4/6/07, Umesh Nayak <penguin.umeshn@...
> <mailto:penguin.umeshn%40yahoo.co.in> > wrote:
> > Dear all,
> >
> > I have installed JUnit 4.3.
> >
> > I have also run
> > java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore org.junit.tests.AllTests
> >
> > as instructed in the Installation steps to verify the installation
> >
> > However, I am not able to get the JUnit TestRunner Swing GUI up and
> running.
> >
> > Please help,
> >
> > Regards,
> >
> > Umesh
